intro: Hemianemia flexuosa f. transitoria, commonly known as the wandering liverwort, is a member of the family Marchantiaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil. The plant exhibits a thallus that is dorsiventral, with distinct upper and lower surfaces. Its leafy structures are arranged in a spiral pattern, and it produces spores in capsules that are borne on stalks. This fern-like liverwort is characterized by its ability to form dense mats and its adaptability to various humid habitats.
